Project Nature: "(T26) This is a CPM position responsible for development, enhancement and support of e-government services in connection with iAM Smart, MyGovHK and Change of Address (COA) service. The iAM Smart provides the one-stop personalised digital services platform which enables citizens to use a single digital identity to log in and use government and commercial online services by their personal mobile phone. MyGovHK is the personalised website of the Government built with Multiple Application Registration Service (MARS) which enables citizens to go through the processes of user registration, service enrollment and user authentication in a unified manner, bringing them a consistent experience in using e-government services. The COA service enables citizens to enter details of personal or company address once and send the updates to multiple government departments and NGOs in one go."
Duties: "- Serve a contract assignment under InfoTech's headcount, full-time second to serve the DPO; ;The CPM will be required to ;1. supervise in-house teams to perform enhancement projects for Change of Address (COA) service, Central Messaging Component (CMC) supporting iAM Smart notification function; ;2. supervise in-house staff to provide maintenance, troubleshooting, system monitoring and 7x24 technical support on the day-to-day operation of MyGovHK, COA and related systems; ;3. provide technical expertise and advice to B/Ds related to adoption of iAM Smart, MyGovHK, COA service and other related services; ;4. coordinate with B/Ds and other organizations in adopting iAM Smart and integrating with MyGovHK and COA service; and ;5. perform other managerial and supervisory duties. ;The successful applicant will be required to work closely with related project teams and government departments. ;"
Requirements: "1. Candidate should have solid experience in implementation/support of infrastructure / common service serving multiple B/Ds or organisations and running at 7x24 dual-active production sites for high availability (i.e. two or more active sites are providing service concurrently. Failure of the application servers at either one site will not affect the availability of the services.) ;2. Candidate should have practical experience in implementing/supporting join-up public e-services involving the integration of various systems across multiple departments or organization units ;3. Candidate should have hands-on experience in SAML 2.0 or OAuth 2.0 implementation for systems acting as Identity Provider and for systems acting as Relying Service ;4. Candidate should have hands-on experience in implementing mobile friendly and accessible e-services that comply with WCAG 2.0 AA standard ;5. Candidate should possess strong sense of analytical and problem solving skills ;6. Candidate should be hard-working and self-motivated with positive attitude ;7. Candidate should be a team-player with good communication and interpersonal skills. ;Technical Skills: ;. At least 4 years' experience in JBoss Application Server (JAS); ;.
